t: Psalm 34
Of David. When he pretended to be insane before Abimelek, who drove him away, and he left.
I*pn will extol the Lord*s at all times; his*ld praise will always be on my lips.
I*ln will glory in the Lord;*s let*ld the afflicted hear and rejoice.
Glorify*ln the Lord*s with me; let*ld us exalt his name together.
I*pn sought the Lord,*s and he answered me; he*ld delivered me from all my fears.
Those*ln who look to him are radiant; their*ld faces are never covered with shame.
This*ln poor man called, and the Lord*s heard him; he*ld saved him out of all his troubles.
The*ln angel of the Lord*s encamps around those who fear him, and*ld he delivers them.
Taste*pn and see that the Lord*s is good; blessed*ld is the one who takes refuge in him.
Fear*ln the Lord,*s you his holy people, for*ld those who fear him lack nothing.
The*ln lions may grow weak and hungry, but*ld those who seek the Lord*s lack no good thing.
Come,*ln my children, listen to me; I*ld will teach you the fear of the Lord.*s
Whoever*ln of you loves life and*ld desires to see many good days,
keep*ln your tongue from evil and*ld your lips from telling lies.
Turn*ln from evil and do good; seek*ld peace and pursue it.
The*pn eyes of the Lord*s are on the righteous, and*ld his ears are attentive to their cry;
but*ln the face of the Lord*s is against those who do evil, to*ld blot out their name from the earth.
The*pn righteous cry out, and the Lord*s hears them; he*ld delivers them from all their troubles.
The*ln Lord*s is close to the brokenhearted and*ld saves those who are crushed in spirit.
The*pn righteous person may have many troubles, but*ld the Lord*s delivers him from them all;
he*ln protects all his bones, not*ld one of them will be broken.
Evil*pn will slay the wicked; the*ld foes of the righteous will be condemned.
The*ln Lord*s will rescue his servants; no*ld one who takes refuge in him will be condemned.
